result.execSummary:
The defendant James S Golembiewski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse - Threat], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court ordered mandatory applicable costs, fees and surcharges to be paid by 10/26/2023. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Defendant to complete domestic abuse assessment and pay the surcharge. 
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank - surcharge IMPOSED.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. James S Golembiewski

records.addlTxt:
Defendant James S Golembiewski in court, in custody.  Attorney Joseph Thomas Domask in court for James S Golembiewski.  Prosecuting attorney Foley J. Van Lieshout Ms. in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

AS TO COUNT ONE; Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.    

AS TO COUNT ONE; Court ordered defendant to serve 68 days in the House of Correction, with 68 days credit for time served.  TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

Court ordered mandatory applicable costs, fees and surcharges to be paid by 10/26/2023.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Defendant to complete domestic abuse assessment and pay the surcharge. 
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank - surcharge IMPOSED.
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.

Defendant James S Golembiewski in court, in custody.  Attorney Joseph Thomas Domask in court for James S Golembiewski.  Prosecuting attorney Navjot Singh Hira in court for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court on defense motion to modify bail.

Bail bond hearing proceeded.   Arguments heard by Defense and the State. Court partially denies Defense's bail motion. Court does not grant motion for bail to be modified to a personal recognizance bond but reduces amount of cash bail. Court reduces $750.00 cash bond to $100.00 cash bond. Defense request a plea and sentencing date. Case adjourned back to Br 15.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant James S Golembiewski not in Court, in custody.  Attorney Joseph Thomas Domask appeared by video for James S Golembiewski.  Attorney Navjot Singh Hira in Court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Bail/Bond hearing. Defendant's appearance waived for today's hearing. Attorney Domask was recently appointed by the Public Defender's Office. Attorney Domask has not had an opportunity to meet with Defendant and requested an adjournment. Court granted request. State to comply with Victim Notification, and provide Defense with discovery material and an offer. Court ordered case adjourned for Bail/Bond hearing. Case remains calendared in Branch 15. Bail/bond hearing scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with GMG (d.o.b. 10/21/89)

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. Court advised Defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge J.D. Watts, Branch 15.   Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned to Branch 15 for pretrial conference.  Defense request to be heard on bail regarding no contact order. This hearing MAY be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/104d9737-ba2f-8811-9083-aed2135824d9
Bail/bond hearing scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
